desc: fatha = Sukun + a；kasra = Sukun  + i；damma = Sukun + u
A short syllable followed by a sukun forms a disyllabic word, with the movable syllable stressed. For example：أَمْ شِبْ
Special case: When encountering نْ, the preceding syllable is stressed with ghunnah, as in: أَنْ (An), مَنْ (Man)
A compound of two short syllables, with the first syllable stressed, termed as 'tashdid' on the first.
A word composed of three harakat, with the middle letter stressed, known as 'madd

feature: Madd：fatha with alif = fatha + ا；Ya with kasra=kasra+ i；Waw with damma =damma+ u
desc: madd pronunciation = Extending the short vowel pronunciation to three counts, termed as 'Madd'.و

feature: When pronouncing, rapidly repeat the letter with shadda twice in succession, the first with sukun and the second with a harakah.

desc: مُدَرِّسٌ (Mudarrisun), جَمَّالٌ (Jammālun), رَكَّبَ (Rakkaba), شَدَّةٌ (Shaddatun), مَكَّةُ (Makkatu), سَبَّحَ (Sabbaha), عَلَّمَ (‘Allama), حَبَّةٌ (Habbatun), بَلَّلَ (Ballala), تَدَرُّبٌ (Tadarrubun), مُتَحَمِّسٌ (Mutahammisun), قِفَّةٌ (Qiffatun), وَلَّى (Wallā), دَفَّاعٌ (Daffā‘un), كَرَّارٌ (Karrārun), فَرَّاشٌ (Farrāshun), أَحَلَّ (Aḥalla), بَرِّيٌّ (Barriyyun), مَسَّاحَةٌ (Massāḥatun), صُدَّامٌ (Suddāmun), حَجٌّ (Ḥajjun), بَدٌّ (Baddun), خَلٌّ (Khallun), رَدٌّ (Raddun), جَدٌّ (Jaddun), وَقٌّ (Waqqu), فَلٌّ (Fallun), دَمٌّ (Dammun), سَبٌّ (Sabbun), وَدٌّ (Waddun).
When a disyllabic word, formed by a short vowel (harakah) and a silent consonant (sukun), is paired with another short vowel, the disyllabic word is stressed
